header.name: chaos/preprocessor/facilities/identity.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines a macro that creates an invokable entity.

macro.abstract: The macro constructs an invokable entity from its argument.

usage.param: The result produced when the result of this macro is invoked.

macro.para: This macro expands to a nullary invokable entity that, when invoked with (), expands to x or __VA_ARGS__.
This macro is often used as a complement to to simulate empty arguments in C (prior to C99) and C++.
Note that, despite its name, is not an "identity" function in the pure sense (i.e. Î»x.x in the lambda calculus).
